metadata-events.title: Campo Teatrale: Somewhere Between
metadata-events.description: Performance in Italian and English. “Somewhere, Between” is a participatory audio-visual performance where audience and performers blur together, boundaries fade, and opposites reveal themselves to be inextricably intertwined in a co-becoming entanglement.
metadata-events.extra-description: Beings do not precede relationships but are born together with them, mutually shaping one another in the infinite weaving of threads that tangle and give rise to worlds upon worlds. Some call it entanglement, but here, it’s just a game—you’re about to step inside.</n>The performance, produced by Campo Teatrale for the event INTERDEPENDENCE – Exploring Opposites 2025, is conceived and created by Usine Baug in collaboration with Pietro Francesco Pingitore (visual artist) and Matrix (New Media Artist – Interactive Sound & Visuals).

metadata-events.title: National College of Art and Design: Alumni Connectivity
metadata-events.people: Dobrawa Brach Kaluzna, Jack Brady, Kathy Mooney, and Sam Russell
metadata-events.description: Join a panel of Ireland's National College of Art & Design (NCAD) faculty and alumni as they come together on the occasion of Politecnico di Milano's INTERDEPENDENCE exhibition during Salone / Milan Design Week 2025.
metadata-events.extra-description: During the panel, NCAD alumni and staff will join together to discuss design practices, establishing studios in the world, and design that demonstrates the vitality of being interdependent in society, globally, and with communities and nature. Panelists will include: Dobrawa Brach Kaluzna (Designer, NCAD Alumni); Jack Brady (Designer, NCAD Alumni); Kathy Mooney (NCAD, Design for Body and Environment), and Sam Russell (NCAD, Product Design).

metadata-events.title: Arte & Magia: Mirror Effect
metadata-events.description: Mirror Effect is a mentalism show created and performed by the Arte & Magia group, where psychological experiments and a touch of comedy intertwine to unveil the mystery of the mirror effect.

metadata-events.title: Creatives for climate - C4C
metadata-events.people: Angela De Marco, with Francesco Zurlo, Anna Luciano, Ilaria Giuliani, Chiara Barozzi, Elisa Flamini, Giancarlo Fabbro, Mattia Battagion, Laura Corà, Matteo Brambilla.
metadata-events.description: The Individual/collective dimension of sustainable communication. A roundtable moderated by Angela De Marco.
metadata-events.extra-description: Selling sustainability' means finding the right balance between two apparent polarities: promoting long-term, collective 'planetary' well-being and highlighting the immediate, concrete, and personal benefits for 'consumers' (or better yet, people). Focusing exclusively on one side risks relegating sustainable initiatives to a niche or diluting their broader impact. The goal, then, is to integrate both perspectives, creating a narrative that appeals to personal motivations while fostering a collective commitment to sustainability. How do we achieve this?

metadata-events.title: POLIMI - DIGITAL AND INTERACTION DESIGN: UNVEILING FUTURES – Interaction Design Beyond the Human
metadata-events.description: From self-driving cars to more-than-human ecologies — glimpse the futures of interaction design.
metadata-events.extra-description: Join us for an interactive session that peeks beyond the horizon of today, offering a window into the possible futures of humanity and our entanglements with the environment. From the future of mobility to radical visions of multispecies governance, this session will traverse the evolving landscape of design—moving from human-centred approaches to more-than-human ways of thinking and making.</n> Lightning talks 18:00 Digital and Interaction Design by Davide Spallazzo, 18:10 Mobility Futures by Marco Ajovalasit, 18:20 More-than-human Bodies by Elisa Giaccardi
